item.title: lib/active_record/base.rb:2808:in `attributes_with_quotes': undefined method `each' for true:TrueClass (NoMethodError)
item.description: OK, hopefully this might help someone some time somewhere. If you are getting the error on the title, it’s mainly because you are using a changed method on your ActiveRecord model. I was working with an ActiveRecord model that handles an string with quotes, so when trying to save the model, that exception was raised. The problem is that ActiveRecord uses a changed method internally for all attributes that were modified.
